subject: Climate & Environment
title: The Water Cycle
description: A fast breakdown of The Water Cycle for builders.

hook.text: The water in your glass may once have been inside a dinosaur. Water is endlessly recycled.

buildup.text: The Sun heats ocean water, which evaporates into the atmosphere as invisible vapor.

discovery.text: Vapor condenses into clouds. Clouds drop rain and snow on land, filling rivers and aquifers.

twist.text: Climate change is speeding up the cycle â€” more evaporation, heavier storms, faster droughts.

climax.text: The total amount of water stays constant. Its distribution is what's shifting.

punchline.text: Earth doesn't lose water. It just moves it to places we don't expect.

quiz.question: How does climate change affect the water cycle?
options: It speeds up evaporation and intensifies storms
